text:
The first German feature-length biopic on Jewish teenage diarist Anne Frank will premiere next month at the 66th Berlin film festival, organisers said on Friday.

Das Tagebuch der Anne Frank ( The Diary of Anne Frank ) will screen in the youth sidebar section Generation of the Berlinale, the first major cinema showcase of the year in Europe.

“This film adaptation of the eponymous historical testimony that moved the world primarily depicts the period of time that Anne spent in her family’s hiding place... in Amsterdam,” the organisers said.

Anne Frank, who was born in Germany and moved to the Netherlands as a child, will be played by German actress Lea van Acken, who starred as the daughter of religiously fanatical Catholic parents in the drama Stations of the Cross , which won best screenplay at the 2014 Berlin festival.

Anne and her family went into hiding from the Nazis in 1942 in a secret annexe at the back of a building owned by her father Otto Frank’s company in Amsterdam, two years after German troops occupied the Netherlands.

She chronicled her life from June 1942 to August 1944 when the family was betrayed. The film festival will kick off on February 11 with a screening of Hollywood’s golden age Hail, Caesar! . — AFP
title: Anne Frank biopic to premiere at Berlin film festival in February
